a107-1.resolution: wq-447 completed by B#375 (s1247) — added mandatory completion format to SESSION_ENGAGE.md at line 417. However, the first E session after the fix (s1248) produced note 'Now entering Phase 2 — the engagement loop.' — same truncated/mid-thought pattern as before.
a107-1.metric_after: 1/1 post-fix E session still has truncated note (s1248)
a107-1.note: Fix exists in the prompt (SESSION_ENGAGE.md line 417-427) but E sessions ignore it. The prompt instructs the format but agents don't output it before session ends. Root cause is likely that E sessions hit budget/time limits before reaching the completion step, not that the format is missing.

a107-2.resolution: wq-448 completed by B#376 (s1249, 6 commits). Full credential audit performed: removed 6 entries (4 defunct, 1 duplicate, 1 dead), linked 2 orphaned credential files, set has_credentials on all 42 remaining. reconcile-registry.mjs built and executed.
a107-2.metric_after: 47 accounts, 22 credential files. 25 accounts confirmed as legitimately credential-less (probe-stage, anonymous platforms).

recommended_actions.description: E session note quality fix (wq-447) was ineffective — s1248 still has truncated note 'Now entering Phase 2 — the engagement loop.' despite mandatory completion format at SESSION_ENGAGE.md:417. This is the 2nd consecutive audit flagging this issue. Root cause hypothesis: E sessions hit budget/time limits before reaching the completion output step, so the format exists in the prompt but is never reached. The fix should be structural — either (a) move the completion format to a post-session hook that extracts it from engagement-trace, or (b) add a pre-completion checkpoint earlier in the E session flow.
recommended_actions.action: R session should investigate why E sessions don't output the completion marker. If the issue is budget exhaustion before reaching the final step, restructure the E session to output the completion line earlier (e.g., as the FIRST thing in Phase 4 instead of the last). Alternatively, a post-session hook could generate the note from engagement-trace.json automatically.

recommended_actions.description: directive-outcomes.json has session_type: null for all entries. This makes per-type compliance analysis impossible without cross-referencing session-history.txt. The directive-outcome.js writer should populate session_type from SESSION_TYPE env var.
recommended_actions.action: Next B session should fix directive-outcome.js to read SESSION_TYPE from environment and write it to the session_type field. This is a one-line fix.
